dcterms:creator: Rashmi Prasad
Nikhil Dinesh
Alan Lee
Eleni Miltsakaki
Livio Robaldo
Aravind Joshi
Bonnie Webber
dcterms:description: The Penn Discourse Treebank (PDTB) adopts a lexically grounded approach to discourse annotation, where discourse relations are lexically anchored by discourse connectives. It provides a framework for annotating explicit and implicit discourse relations.
dcterms:title: Penn Discourse TreeBank (PDTB)

dcterms:creator: Nianwen Xue
Fei Xia
Fu dong Chiou
Martha Palmer
dcterms:description: The Chinese Treebank provides phrase structure annotation of a large corpus of Chinese text, facilitating various linguistic analyses and applications.
dcterms:title: Chinese Treebank

dcterms:creator: Rashmi Prasad
Eleni Miltsakaki
Nikhil Dinesh
Alan Lee
Aravind Joshi
Livio Robaldo
Bonnie Webber
dcterms:description: The PDTB 2.0 Annotation Manual provides guidelines for annotating discourse relations in the Penn Discourse Treebank, detailing the procedures and principles behind the annotation process.
dcterms:title: PDTB 2.0 Annotation Manual

dcterms:creator: Lynn Carlson
Daniel Marcu
Mary Ellen Okurowski
dcterms:description: This corpus is built in the framework of Rhetorical Structure Theory, providing a resource for studying discourse relations and their structures.
dcterms:title: Discourse-Tagged Corpus in the Framework of Rhetorical Structure Theory

dcterms:creator: Nianwen Xue
dcterms:description: This work focuses on annotating discourse connectives within the Chinese Treebank, enhancing the understanding of discourse relations in Chinese text.
dcterms:title: Annotating Discourse Connectives in the Chinese Treebank
